citation: Proclamation under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 15A of the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 –

        (a) alter the names specified in column 1 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation, previously given under the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 to the areas of reserved land specified in column 3 of that Schedule, to the names specified in column 2 of that Schedule; and
        (b) alter the name previously given to Steppes State Reserve by the proclamation notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1975, No. 326 to The Steppes State Reserve; and
        (c) give the name specified in column 1 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation to so much of the relevant area of land specified in column 2 of that Schedule that was previously declared to be a State reserve under section 15(1) of the National Parks and Wildlife Act 1970 and that has not been previously named; and
        (d) declare that this proclamation takes effect on 29 April 1999.
28 April 1999

G. S. M. GREEN

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

D. E. LLEWELLYN

Minister for Primary Industries, Water and Environment

SCHEDULE 1 - Alteration of name of reserved land

Column 1  Column 2  Column 3      Areas of reserved land  Previous name of reserved land  Name of reserved land  Description  Approx. Area  George Town Wildlife Sanctuary  George Town Conservation Area  Land bounded by heavy black lines on Central Plan Register Plan 4845  121 ha  Lake Dulverton Wildlife Sanctuary  Lake Dulverton Conservation Area  Land bounded by heavy black lines on Central Plan Register Plan 4846  217 ha  South Arm Wildlife Sanctuary  South Arm Conservation Area  Land bounded by heavy black lines on Central Plan Register Plan 2086  784 ha  Sundown Point Aboriginal Site  Sundown Point State Reserve  Land bounded by heavy black lines on Central Plan Register Plan 4849  132 ha  Tamar River Wildlife Sanctuary  Tamar River Conservation Area  Land bounded by heavy black lines on Central Plan Register Plan 4850  4,600 ha  Trial Harbour Aboriginal Site  Trial Harbour State Reserve  Land bounded by heavy black lines on Central Plan Register Plan 4840  8,260 sq.m.
